summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) documenting a voluntary interview conducted on August 5, 2021, with a Senior Officer from the Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. The officer was assigned to the Special Housing Unit on August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein was found unresponsive.

keyFacts: The document is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC New York on August 10, 2019.
A Senior BOP Officer assigned to the MCC Special Housing Unit on August 9, 2019, was interviewed by the OIG on August 5, 2021.

The interview was recorded and transcribed, and the memorandum lists 14 attachments including interview transcripts, assignment rosters, activity logs, and internal memoranda from the dates surrounding Epstein's death.
The document explicitly states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG and is restricted from distribution outside the receiving agency.
